About Me

QUICK INTRO

I am an entrepreneur, programmer, and ecommerce marketer. I am also the Creative Director I help retail and ecommerce businesses make money and build brands people care about through web development, paid advertising, and social media marketing. See MY WORK here.

Web Development

Proficient in HTML, CSS (with Sass), JavaScript (with Vue) and Bootstrap. I also have this new thing going for GraphQL which I use when working with React. I also know how to use other tools like JSON, AJAX and XML.

Backend web development

Django has been my main go to when it comes to backend because of its ease of use and rapid development, I also use PHP frequently (I don't like it but it does the job). Node.js is another tool I use but because of the projects I have been doing it has been less favoured (Vue.js and Node.js project loading though ). My stack also consists of MySQL, and MongoDB and I also use and build REST APIs

Web Design

I have been using Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator for over 2 years now.
I use Figma for wireframing and prototyping evrytime I start a big project that I want to visualize.
It helps me pay atttention to the details and work using the constraints, instead of doing unplanned work.
I use Photoshop for designing websites and image conversion (when I design a website and I want images with transparent background, although lately I have been going back to old pen and paper and designing in the browser) and Adobe Illustrator for exploring creative ideas when I feel like drawing or coming up with a new concept for an application.

Programming

My journey started off with C++ (Hell, I know.) Although nowadays I recall bits of it as what you don't use, you lose. It was 10 or 11 years later until I got back to programming... mere months after finishing high school in my gap year (This is my 3rd gap year).
When I got back to programming, the language I learnt first was Python. I chose it for many reasons (number one being ease of use as I didn't want to complicate my life like I did with C++, number two being multiparadigm). It opened many doors and helped boost my confidence.
C++ didn't dull my courage though, it forced me to learn the fundamentals of programming and Computer Science anew.
As a result I now take a more principled approach to coding through having learnt data structures and algorithms.
